definition: without favoring one party, in a fair evenhanded manner, very pleasing to the eye, a traveling show, join so that the external surfaces blend smoothly
details:
adverb
- without favoring one party, in a fair evenhanded manner
= example: without favoring one party, in a fair evenhanded manner
= synonyms: fairly, evenhandedly
- in conformity with the rules or laws and without fraud or cheating
= example: in conformity with the rules or laws and without fraud or cheating
= synonyms: fairly
adjective
- very pleasing to the eye
= synonyms: bonny, bonnie, comely, sightly
- of hair or skin, pale or light-colored
= example: of hair or skin, pale or light-colored
= synonyms: fairish
- free of clouds or rain
= example: free of clouds or rain
- in baseball, hit between the foul lines
= example: in baseball, hit between the foul lines
- free from favoritism or self-interest or bias or deception
= synonyms: just
- gained or earned without cheating or stealing
= synonyms: honest
- a manuscript with few alterations or corrections
= example: a manuscript with few alterations or corrections
= synonyms: clean
- not excessive or extreme
= example: not excessive or extreme
= synonyms: fairish, reasonable
- lacking exceptional quality or ability
= synonyms: middling
- attractively feminine
noun
- a traveling show
= synonyms: carnival
- a sale of miscellany
= synonyms: bazaar
- a competitive exhibition of farm products
= example: a competitive exhibition of farm products
- gathering of producers to promote business
= example: gathering of producers to promote business
verb
- join so that the external surfaces blend smoothly
